item.title: China's Unbalancing Is Going Into Overdrive
item.description:
China‚Äôs trade surplus is soaring thanks to ‚ÄúCovid Zero‚Äù and the ongoing crisis in the real estate sector. Domestic spending is being squeezed, which is holding down imports even as exports continue to hold up. The result is a great ‚Äúunbalancing‚Äù, with debt rising relative to income and a smaller share of Chinese production enjoyed by ordinary Chinese‚Ä¶

URL: https://theovershoot.co/p/chinas-unbalancing-is-going-into?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: From the Cutting Room Floor: A Prologue to ‚ÄúSlouching Towards Utopia‚Äù, &

item.title: Mary the Tower
item.description:
July 22 is the Feast Day of Mary Magdalene, beloved of Jesus, and the ‚ÄúApostle to the Apostles.‚Äù Earlier this week, I posted an audio of a sermon I delivered at the Wild Goose Festival on ‚ÄúAll the Marys.‚Äù Within just a few hours after posting it here at The Cottage, it was downloaded nearly 10,000 times. Many listeners asked for a written text ‚Äî here it‚Ä¶

URL: https://dianabutlerbass.substack.com/p/mary-the-tower?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.description:

item.title: Will Merrick Garland Solve the Republicans‚Äô Problem for Them?
item.description:
No TNB tonight: We‚Äôre watching the hearing at 8:00 p.m. and you should, too. 1. ‚ÄúBoosting,‚Äù Again Jonathan Swan made me lose my mind a little bit yesterday: I think this summary is somewhat misleading. Let me explain. If you read Swan‚Äôs summary and haven‚Äôt actually watched the ads, you might reasonably conclude that Democrats were running pro-Cox ads, in which they made an affirmative argument for Cox‚Äîor portrayed him as a good candidate‚Äîand that now Democrats have to ‚Äúpivot‚Äù in their messaging to describe Cox as extreme‚Ä¶

URL: https://thetriad.thebulwark.com/p/will-merrick-garland-solve-the-republicans?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
